item.title: Poke-Yoke: The Art of Mistake Proofing
item.description: Learn how a fundamental lean technique -- poke-yoke -- can be used to dramatically reduce errors and defects in manufacturing.
item.author: Bosch Rexroth - kevin.gingerich@boschrexroth-us.com
item.itunes:author: Bosch Rexroth - kevin.gingerich@boschrexroth-us.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Learn how a fundamental lean technique -- poke-yoke -- can be used to dramatically reduce errors and defects in manufacturing.
item.itunes:summary: Making mistakes is human -- what we don't want to make is defects. A fundamental Lean Manufacturing technique is Poke-Yoke: The Art of Mistake Proofing. Patricia Wardwell, Chief Operating Officer of the Greater Boston Manufacturing Partnership (GBMP) {http://www.gbmp.org} explains how Poke-Yoke is a tool organizations can use to help people avoid making mistakes and help prevent passing the defect on to the next recipient in the value chain.
item.itunes:keywords: lean fundamentals, lean management, poke yoke, zero defects, lean transformation, lean manufacturing, Shingo Prize, Greater Boston Manufacturing Partnership, GBMP, lean organizations

item.title: Designing New Facilities to Be Lean
item.description: Learn the importance of using kaizen principles and lean techniques to design, build and launch new production facilities.

item.itunes:author: Bosch Rexroth - kevin.gingerich@boschrexroth-us.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Learn the importance of using kaizen principles and lean techniques to design, build and launch new production facilities.
item.itunes:summary: When investing in new production facilities, lean manufacturers recognize the importance of using lean principles and techniques to design, build, and launch new production facilities. item.title: Lean manufacturing and automation technology
item.description: Principles and techniques for using automation technology to improve lean manufacturing performance.
item.author: Bosch Rexroth - kevin.gingerich@boschrexroth-us.com
item.itunes:author: Bosch Rexroth - kevin.gingerich@boschrexroth-us.com
item.itunes:subtitle: Principles and techniques for using automation technology to improve lean manufacturing performance.
item.itunes:summary: Many lean “experts” assert that automation technology and lean manufacturing are incompatible – that automation is a high-throughput, production line-capacity driven technology that doesn’t work well with demand-driven, lean production environments. In this podcast, lean consultant Jamie Flinchbaugh offers an alternate view: if automation technology solves manufacturing problems – which is the basic goal of lean – then automation is, by definition, lean.
